content.description: Start in the left facing jug under the overlap, find a sharp edge to undercling in the overlap, walk your feet up and make a big reach past a few really bad intermediate to a super sharp edge, slap left for a tips left facing little flake that has a good horizontal crimp along the top. Finish a big slap up to the top for a delicate mantel or a messy belly flop.
content.location: In-between The Forge and Elwood's Arete.

content.description: Sit start: sit on the sloping rock base and find the crimp to the right. Work your way up with jams to your left and positive crimps to your right before topping out.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. Natural pro above for TR
content.location: Crack on the left end of the Winfield Wall

content.description: Layback the huge flake to the right of Elwood's Arete and use several pretty little edges on the face to top out (likely with a bellyflop).
Sit start: Find the undercling to the left of the thin splitter crack. Work your way up the thin crack using a variety of holds before topping out.
content.protection: Pads and spotters. There is natural pro above for TR
content.location: Middle-right of Winfield Wall, look for the thin crack

content.description: Sit Start: Pull the base of the arete and work your way up using the jugs before topping out. Â Stacked/wedged rocks on the right are off
content.protection: Pads and spotters, natural pro above for TR
content.location: Right end of Winfield wall, D on the hand-drawn map.

content.description:
10-12 foot wall with various boulder problems ranging from beginner to advanced.

 Depicted as D in the hand-drawn map
